title: Insufficient Return Check for createPool in createAndInitializePoolIfNecessary Function
validator comment: This is checked within the OZ Create2.sol contract when `deploy` is called [here](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/v4.8.0/contracts/utils/Create2.sol#L41)

title: The token get burnt too early when collecting the fee.
validator comment: The reason the check is not required is because `tokensOwed0` and `tokensOwed1` will always default to zero after a collect call. In [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/periphery/NonfungiblePositionManager.sol#L390-L393), we assign the current full amount of `tokensOwed0` and `tokensOwed1` if it does not exceed uin128.max determined by the amount0Max and amount1Max flags as seen [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/periphery/NonfungiblePositionManager.sol#L354-L356) (which in itself is highly unrealistic). As such when the subsequent full decrementation happens [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/periphery/NonfungiblePositionManager.sol#L407), `position.tokensOwed0` and `position.tokensOwed1` will default to zero

title: Address Collision Can Cause Stolen Funds
Users at Risk of Price Manipulation Due to Absence of Liquidity Thresholds and Whitelisting
validator comment: It doesn't make sense to restrict the amount of liquidity during pool creation. It is users responsibility to decide which pools they are willing to interact with. This also has the exact same implementation as Uniswap as seen [here](https://github.com/Uniswap/v3-core/blob/main/contracts/UniswapV3Factory.sol#L35-L51)

title: Potential Loss of Tokens Due to Incomplete Collection Check Before Burning Position

validator comment: The values returned by functions within `SqrtPriceMath` called by `_modifyPosition` will always return unsigned ints, so this is a non-issue.

title: Slippage Protection and Price Manipulation Checks Missing in Katana V3 _modifyPosition

title: Unchecked/Unvalidated External Call Return Values leads to
validator comment: This is OOS per contest [details](https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-10-ronin?tab=readme-ov-file#automated-findings--publicly-known-issues): 'Centralization risk. title: Integer overflow in NonFungibleTokenPositionDescriptor.sol
validator comment: This can never happen, since all the return values are constant and will never be greater than uint256.max

title: Public Exposure of Position Data in positions() Enables Precise MEV Extraction
validator comment: This is a non-issue, since there are slippages in place to prevent sandwich attacks.

title: Rebase Vulnerability in Katana V3 mint Function Can Cause Incorrect Liquidity Provisioning
validator comment: Known assumption as seen [here](https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-10-ronin?tab=readme-ov-file#assumptions): 'The token balance of an address can only change due to a call to transfer by the sender or transferFrom by an approved address, i.e. rebase tokens and interest bearing tokens are excluded.'

title: Lack of Price Impact & Slippage Protection in quoteExactInput
Inefficient Tick Update Mechanism in Katana V3 Causes Excessive Gas Costs for Multi-Range Positions
validator comment: Extremely vague issue, insufficient proof and quality

title: no check on the liquidity holder
validator comment: The function is gated to the caller `msg.sender`  , users cannot arbitrarily invoke migration for other users

title: lack safeApprove before call TransferHelper.safeTransferFrom
validator comment: Not required, approvals are provided externally.

title: `migrate()` lack slippage control
validator comment: Slippage is present when `INonfungiblePositionManager.mint` is called and eventually checked within `LiquidityManagement.addLiquidity`

title: A call to pool.collect from `NonFungiblePositionManager.collect` will be returned
eth being struck in AggregateRouter.
check for token in checkPair
validator comment: This is not required as the check exists in `checkPool` [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/core/KatanaV3Factory.sol#L80)

title: Common tokens such as WETH9 work differently on chains such a Blast which isn't taken into account during transfer calls
validator comment: The only chain the contracts are deployed on is the Ronin chain as noted [here](https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-10-ronin?tab=readme-ov-file#general-questions)

title: slot0 is easy to manupilate
Downcasting Issue in Protocol Fee Calculation
validator comment: [Known consideration](https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-10-ronin?tab=readme-ov-file#assumptions). It is unrealistic for fees to every reach that kind of state given totalSupply limit assumption. Additionally, fees can always be collected before this levels are reached. 'The total supply of any token does not exceed 2128 - 1, i.e. type(uint128).max.'

title: wrong implement of initializeImmutables in KatanaV3Pool
validator comment: The check is correct to prevent reinitialization once factory address has been set

title: Balance Verification in mint Function Leading to Token Minting Failures
validator comment: There is no issue here, <= is used because the `balance0Before` and `balance1Before` was the previously cached balances before the tokens were transferred to the pool by LP, the check is working correctly. If we use >=, it can potentially revert for FOT tokens. Same exact implementation as [UniswapV3Pool.sol](https://github.com/Uniswap/v3-core/blob/main/contracts/UniswapV3Pool.sol#L483-L484)

title: Users may perform trades or provide liquidity based on the assumption that the pool has a valid price.
The `totalFeeGrowth0` and `totalFeeGrowth1` variables are not updated along with their corresponding `feeGrowthGlobal0X128` and `feeGrowthGlobal1X128` variables.
validator comment: There are no such state variables since protocol fees are immediately transferred directly to the treasury as een [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/core/KatanaV3Pool.sol#L738-L740), as per design mentioned in [contest details](https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-10-ronin?tab=readme-ov-file#main-invariants). 'Protocol fees will be directly transferred to the treasury without fee-collecting operations needed'

title: If `feeProtocolNum` equals `feeProtocolDen`, it would mean 100% of the fees go to the protocol, which is likely unintended.
validator comment: Note, this are not present in the automated finding report for known issues. Grouping all input validation issues together. They should all likely be at most QA and argubly invalid based on the following [READ.ME information](https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-10-ronin?tab=readme-ov-file#automated-findings--publicly-known-issues): ' Centralization risk. Sky Mavis is responsible for maintaining the Katana V3 contracts and will able to upgrade the contract if necessary, as well as specify additional fee tiers.'

title: use safemint instead of mint.
validator comment: OOS, given uniswapV3 utilizes the same exact logic as seen [here](https://github.com/Uniswap/v3-periphery/blob/main/contracts/NonfungiblePositionManager.sol#L156): 'All public known issues, including public audit reports of Uniswap V3 that affect Katana V3'

title: Reentrancy Risk in the migrate Function
validator comment: Lack sufficient proof. Additionally, the migrator contract is not expected to hold funds since appropriate refunds will be given.

title: Missing Authorization Check in Flash Loan Function
validator comment: The subsequent [checks here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/core/KatanaV3Pool.sol#L774-L775) enforces that the user MUST have returned the flashloaned funds + the fees within the flashloan call `katanaV3FlashCallback` callback, if not the call will revert

title: Zero-Fee Pool Vulnerability in `KatanaV3Factory`
validator comment: There is no indication that zero-fee pools cannot be allowed

title: wrong implement of nativeCurrencyLabel
Liquidity providers may face difficulties when managing their positions, as the inconsistent tick state can affect their ability to add or remove liquidity correctly.
Wrong init code hash
Incorrect accounting of total fees collected by the pool, leading to discrepancies in financial records and reporting.
validator comment: There are no such state variables since protocol fees are immediately transferred directly to the treasury as een [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/core/KatanaV3Pool.sol#L738-L740), as per design mentioned in [contest details](https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-10-ronin?tab=readme-ov-file#main-invariants): 'Protocol fees will be directly transferred to the treasury without fee-collecting operations needed'

title: Insufficient Liquidity Check in Flash Loan Function
validator comment: This is essentially a non-issue, either way, it would revert even if an additional check is added due to insufficient funds available for flashloan

title: `totalPools` variable will not accurately reflect the number of pools created.
validator comment: There is no `totalPools` state variable

title: `setTreasury` allows setting treasury to the current address
validator comment: Known issue [NC-11](https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-10-ronin/blob/main/4naly3er-report.md#nc-11-lack-of-checks-in-setters)

title: Protocol Fee Ratio Bypass Leading to Excessive Fee Extraction
`initialize()` function lacks a check to ensure that the provided `sqrtPriceX96` is non-zero before assigning it to `slot0.sqrtPriceX96`
Fee Parameter Manipulation Through Race Condition in KatanaV3Factory
validator comment: There seem to be some missunderstanding of how transactions work. Once `enableFeeAmount`, the transaction has to be completed before the updates are completed, and thus is atomic, so this is a non-issue.

title: Unchecked Liquidity Burn Allows Excessive Token Withdrawal
validator comment: Users cannot abitrarily burn tokens from other LPs since the call is gated to the caller `msg.sender`.

title: V3factory will fail to initialize because of a wrong check
Inaccurate `totalPools` Count
validator comment: There is no `totalPools` state variable.

title: Parameters mostly not checked for initializeImmutables function
Improper Validation of `tickSpacing` Parameter in `initializeImmutables` Function
Handling External Calls to IERC20Metadata.decimals() Failing Silently
validator comment: Seems at most low/QA, wrapper contract could be used? Also the contracts are only supported on ronin chain, which is unlikely for tokens to exhibit such a behavior.

title: Fee Growth Accumulation Bug: Instead of accumulating fees, the code overwrites the previous fee growth values.
validator comment: The global fee tracker is already incremented [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/core/KatanaV3Pool.sol#L649) before assignment, this is a non-issue

title: Incorrect Balance Check in Swap Function Leads to Pool Imbalance
validator comment: The warden seemed to have attempted to change the smart contract logic to introduce a bug. There is no issue here if you check the correct affected lines of code [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/core/KatanaV3Pool.sol#L734)

title: CREATE2` address collision during pool deployment allows for complete draining of the pool
Multiple Pool Creation Enables Liquidity Fragmentation and Market Manipulation
validator comment: OOS. 'Centralization risk. Sky Mavis is responsible for maintaining the Katana V3 contracts and will able to upgrade the contract if necessary, as well as specify additional fee tiers.'

title: Improper Token Address Validation in `createPool` Function
validator comment: The check is not required, since no matter what, token0 will represent the zero address due to the assignment above.

title: Katana Governance will never be able to initialize the V3factory because of a wrong check
Pool Initialization with Extreme Prices Can Break Core Pool Mechanics
Change of Router in the Katana governance will cause all Calls from the new router to revert.
validator comment: Not an issue, given the externnal  [`setAllowedActor`](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-operation-contracts/blob/27f9d28e00958bf3494fa405a8a5acdcd5ecdc5d/src/governance/KatanaGovernance.sol#L95-L97) can be subsequently invoked.

title: Zero-Amount Flash Loans Not Prevented
validator comment: There is no reason to invoke a zero amount flashloan, and there will be no impact, so arguably, there is no need to check for it.

title: Oracle Observation Array Size Mismatch with Maximum Cardinality
validator comment: 65535 creates a fixed array size that can hold 65535 elements that is indexed from 0-65534, no issue here

title: Manipulation of pool balances and pricing allows Borrowing Beyond Pool Balance
validator comment: The subsequent [checks here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/core/KatanaV3Pool.sol#L774-L775) enforces that the user MUST have returned the flashloaned funds + the fees within the flashloan call `katanaV3FlashCallback` callback, if not the call will revert

title: Complete draining of the pool's assets in Flash function
validator comment: The following statement is incorrect and misunderstands how modifiers work. The lock will only be reassigned after execution of the function logic. 'The lock modifier releases the lock (slot0.unlocked = true;) prematurely, before the flash function completes its execution.'

title: Inconsistent Fee Growth Accounting in Swap Function
Memory Array Length Manipulation Vulnerability in Whitelist Token Management
validator comment: This is a view function to retrieve information of whitelisted tokens, there is no possible manipulation here.

title: Users may receive incorrect amounts during swaps Protocol fees could be miscalculated
NonfungiblePositionManager has increaseLiquidity Function Missing Authorization Check
Missing authorization check in `increaseLiquidity` permits unauthorized liquidity addition
Unbounded Token Collection Can Lead to Unexpected Reverts
validator comment: It is correct to revert if the user attempt to collect more than intended tokens owed to them

title: AggregateRouter has execute Function May Enter an Infinite Loop Under Certain Conditions
Inconsistent Liquidity State in Tick Updates
Use of unchecked arithmetic operations
validator comment: The SafeCast library is utilized, so overflow is not possible

title: Flash Loan State Manipulation via Reentrancy
validator comment: The modifier `lock` serves as the reentrancy protection ,there is no issue here.

title: fee growth calculation in the swap function incorrectly handles the order of operations between protocol fee deduction and fee growth updates
Zero Denominator Vulnerability in Fee Protocol Parameter Validation
Incorrect Liquidity Accounting During Position Burns
Cross-site scripting risk in NFT position descriptor due to insufficient token symbol validation
validator comment: This is OOS and not a smart contract logic issue. Additionally, we have the same implementation in uniswapV3 as seen [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/periphery/libraries/NFTDescriptor.sol)

title: Authorization Through tx.origin
validator comment: No bypass is possible, even if the caller is spoofed, the calling context must be the router set in the katana governance contract with the appropriate logic

title: Minting with Extreme Tick Values
Attacker can drain pool liquidity by manipulating balance checks
validator comment: There is no issue here, <= can be used since it would mean the user has repaid the amount flashloaned + fees. The second point is incorrect since the balance of pool has been previously cached [here](https://github.com/ronin-chain/katana-v3-contracts/blob/03c80179e04f40d96f06c451ea494bb18f2a58fc/src/core/KatanaV3Pool.sol#L762-L763). See similar implementation in [UniswapV3Pool](https://github.com/Uniswap/v3-core/blob/main/contracts/UniswapV3Pool.sol#L802-L811)

title: use memory safe for assembly.
validator comment: We shouldn't be arbitrarily utilizing memory safe functionalities without concrete proof, which the warden hasn't explained.
